Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 6/30/2017 at 5:28 PM, Slaver0110 said:
> 
> 
> Same question here, as it's the last mod I need for 1.3.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ETT for 1.2 works just fine, but the parts are all out of whack, and all my saves are for that.  I'll wait.
> 

I've just upgraded my 1.2.2 game to 1.3. I have had no problems. [@Slaver0110](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/178402-slaver0110/), do you have another tree loaded?  Anyway, I will see if I can get it officially updated to 1.3 on the 4th.

Sweet.

The only real problems are with placement on the tree itself, due to renaming in the .cfg files (mostly in Near Future Spacecraft).  A fix was posted on the Spacedock thread for this, pertaining to the Mk-3 command pod, so it's not a big deal.

edit  the cfg-file name change was causing a save-break.

I have CTT installed, but it's never given me any conflicts that I can see, even under 1.2.2 (Yonge TechTree Manager seems to handle it well when starting a new Career).

Once again, thank you for ETT.  I appreciate the hard work.

And Cheers!!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-02T03:50:40Z" title="07/02/2017 03:50  AM" data-short="7 yr">July 2, 2017</time> by Slaver0110**
  
Edited for clarity

Updated to 1.3, Thanks [@linuxgurugamer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129964-linuxgurugamer/)!

Added ModPods, EVA Parachutes & Ejection Seats, SETI Probe Parts.

Adjusted some part placements.

Added a "Radial Engines" Node. Cleaned up the fuels/conversion/drills branch.
Installed

installed it, but the tree in the r&d has massive amounts of lines going everywhere... ill get screenshots up tonight

[@toric5](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/58046-toric5/) I guess the above quote from the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> made you think it works with CTT - I also tried that - but it's not real.

I also had massive lines going everywhere...

>

I do believe I need to remove that line. It is no longer compatible with CTT.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Probus said:
> 
> 
> I do believe I need to remove that line. It is no longer compatible with CTT.
> 

ah, ok. thanks. does it still have all the nodes from the CTT? (so that mods that you do not support still have somewhere to go)

I feel like cryotanks needs a look at. if you never research nuculear, you may go without 3 meter cryo tanks. on the same note, it could be easy to get 2.5 meter nukes before getting 2.5 m cryo tanks... (also, karbonite and <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> warpdrive support?)

Couldn't figure out how to set up a pull request on github, but I went through and fixed all the Bluedog Design parts, save for a few that don't show up in the editor. 

This may need some further balancing but here is the config file:

[Bluedog Designs](https://www.dropbox.com/s/fp6e864o38fuzpq/EngTechTree.cfg?dl=0)

  I will review and add your changes.
Ah, good to see that this is still going strong!:) Definitely the go-to techtree!
It probably needs another pass through for balancing, but at least the parts are in sort of the right places now.
I might get to launching KSP again this weekend and have a look around, I'll suggest changes on the github if I find anything too off in the aerodynamics section.:)

There are some new KSPI-E parts and upgrades today.

Have you added them to ETT yet
[@Probus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/102512-probus/) what science percentage would you recommend to make ETT take as long as stock?
This mod seems to spam *a lot* of messages to the log. Any way you could find the offending code in YongeTech\_TreesPlugin,  comment it out or change it, and recompile?
I am experiencing huge lag when ETT is installed

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Iso-Polaris said:
> 
> 
> I am experiencing huge lag when ETT is installed
> 

That doesn't make sense.  What other mods do you have, and did you install any others around the same time?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, lordcirth said:
> 
> 
> That doesn't make sense.  What other mods do you have, and did you install any others around the same time?

i haven't installed any mod at the same time, after I unintstalled ETT, the lag was gone

>

> 9 hours ago, Iso-Polaris said:
> 
> 
> I am experiencing huge lag when ETT is installed
> 

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, lordcirth said:
> 
> 
> That doesn't make sense.  What other mods do you have, and did you install any others around the same time?
> 

It's most likely because the YongeTech plugin that comes with the ETT spams *a lot* of messages to the output log. Any mod that spams the log tends to cause lag.
1.3 update in May but I don't see it on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>?

I will try to figure out what the errors are [@Iso-Polaris](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/165467-iso-polaris/).  The Yonge mod is quite old.  [@linuxgurugamer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129964-linuxgurugamer/) recompiled it for me, but he is really busy and doesn't usually have time to debug mods on a regular basis.  My "C" is pretty rusty, but I will look at it.  If anyone can tell me what's up with the errors, I will do my best to fix them.
